trial_identification.studytitle: Perth Longitudinal Study of Aging in Women
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A 15-year longitudinal study investigating the role of environmental, anatomical, physiological, metabolic and genetic factors on health outcomes in older women.

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Diseases of the vasculature and circulation including the lymphatic system

interventions.interventions: Baseline and longitudinal measurements of phenotypic data related to the health of older women including environmental factors (e.g. dietary intakes, physical activity), anatomical measures (e.g. bone mass and structure, anthropometry, body composition, carotid intimal medial thickness), physiological function (e.g. mobility, muscle strength), metabolic function (e.g. ApoE levels, hormonal status, homocysteine, beta-amyloid), and genetic polymorphisms (e.g. estrogen receptor, TGF beta, ApoE 4, Cyp19, MTHFR). The duration of observation was from 1998 to 2013. All participants were initially recruited in 1998 to a 5-year randomised controlled trial, the Calcium Intake Fracture Outcome Study (trial ID ACTRN12615000750583). Participants were then enrolled for an additional 10-year follow-up study (2003-2013).

primaryOutcome.outcome: Fracture-related events assessed by self-reported events and data linkage to hospital admission/discharge records.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Data linkage to hospital admission/discharge records is available for each participant from their baseline visit until their date of death or 15 years post baseline visit.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Cardiovascular events assessed by data linkage to hospital admission/discharge and mortality records.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Data linkage to hospital admission/discharge and mortality records is available for each participant from their baseline visit until their date of death or 15 years post baseline visit.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Neurocognitive function assessed by Abbreviated Mini Mental Score, California Verbal Learning Test, CAMCOG, and the Mini Mental State Exam.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Abbreviated Mini Mental State Score was assessed at baseline, 5, 7, 10 and 12 years. The California Verbal Learning Test and CAMCOG was assessed at 3 and 4 years. The Mini Mental State Exam was assessed at 3, 4, 10 and 12 years.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Cancer-related events assessed by data linkage to hospital admission/discharge and mortality records.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Data linkage to hospital admission/discharge records is available for each participant from their baseline visit until their date of death or 15 years post baseline visit.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Renal disease-related events assessed by data linkage to hospital admission/discharge and mortality records.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Data linkage to hospital admission/discharge records is available for each participant from their baseline visit until their date of death or 15 years post baseline visit.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: The key inclusion criteria was age greater than 70 years and less than or equal to 85 years, and likelihood to survive a 5-year study. This key inclusion criteria was for all participants previously enrolled in the Calcium Intake Fracture Outcome Study (trial ID ACTRN12615000750583).
eligibility.exclusivecriteria:
Receipt of a bone active agent. This exclusion criteria was for all participants previously enrolled in the Calcium Intake Fracture Outcome Study (trial ID ACTRN12615000750583).
There were no other specific exclusions so that the results could be generalized to the entire ambulant population.

fundingsource.fundingname: National Health and Medical Research Council of Australia
fundingsource.fundingaddress: GHD Building Level 1, 16 Marcus Clarke Street, Canberra ACT 2601

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The aim of this 15-year follow-up study was to determine the influence of environmental, anatomical, metabolic, physiological and genetic determinants on health outcomes in older women. This was a follow-up study of 1500 women aged 70 years and over, recruited from the general population of Perth, Western Australia.
